questions.prompt: In BG 12.1, what is Arjuna's question to Krishna?
choices: About politics and worldly philosophical speculation
About rituals and worldly philosophical speculation
Strategy of war through independent material processes
Is devotion to your personal form superior to impersonal meditation?
questions.feedback: Arjuna seeks to know the best path among various spiritual approaches.

questions.prompt: According to BG 12.2, what does Krishna declare about the best path?
choices: Those who worship my personal form with faith are most advanced
No path leads far through independent material processes
Impersonal is better through independent material processes
every are equal through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Personal devotion to Krishna is the most direct path to the goal.

questions.prompt: In BG 12.3-4, what does Krishna teach about those who meditate on the impersonal?
choices: They advance quickly through independent material processes
They labor more and progress slowly; the path is arduous
They reach easily through independent material processes
They are superior through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The impersonal path requires immense effort and discipline.

questions.prompt: What does BG 12.5 teach about those devoted to the impersonal Brahman?
choices: They stagnate and worldly philosophical speculation
They eventually attain me; the path is less direct
They suffer and worldly philosophical speculation
They are blessed through independent material processes
questions.feedback: All sincere seekers eventually reach the same goal, but by different routes.

questions.prompt: According to BG 12.6, what is the easiest path?
choices: Renounce every to me
Ritualistic and worldly philosophical speculation
Impersonal meditation and worldly philosophical speculation
Extreme austerity and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Simple, wholehearted surrender to Krishna is the easiest path.

questions.prompt: In BG 12.7, what should one do if unable to fix mind on Krishna?
choices: Practice yoga discipline; strive to reach me through continued practice
Give up spirituality through independent material processes
Pursue material goals through independent material processes
Accept defeat and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Persistent practice through yoga discipline gradually elevates consciousness.

questions.prompt: What does BG 12.8-10 teach about the gradual ascent?
choices: If unable to practice yoga, practice renunciation
every must be perfect immediately
It is impossible through independent material processes
Stages are not real through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Even work offered to Krishna with detachment elevates the soul.

questions.prompt: According to BG 12.11, what is the essence of all spiritual practices?
choices: Give up attachment to fruits; perform duty for my sake
Rituals alone and worldly philosophical speculation
Meditation primarily and worldly philosophical speculation
Knowledge solely and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Selfless service to Krishna is the heart of all spiritual disciplines.

questions.prompt: In BG 12.12, what is superior between knowledge and meditation?
choices: Meditation is superior to mere knowledge
They are equal through independent material processes
Knowledge is best through independent material processes
Meditation is least through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The hierarchy progresses from knowledge to practice to spiritual detachment.

questions.prompt: What does BG 12.13-14 teach about the ideal devotee?
choices: Favoritism and worldly philosophical speculation
One who hates no living being, is friendly, compassionate free from attachment
Selfish love and worldly philosophical speculation
Hatred of enemies through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The perfect devotee embodies universal love and compassion.

questions.prompt: According to BG 12.15, what characterizes a true devotee?
choices: Disturbance by events through independent material processes
Fixed in Krishna consciousness; unaffected by joy or sorrow
Seeks pleasure constantly through independent material processes
Easily disturbed and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: The devotee remains internally balanced through Krishna consciousness.

questions.prompt: In BG 12.16, what is the qualification for being dear to Krishna?
choices: Ritual observance and worldly philosophical speculation
Wealth and power through independent material processes
Knowledge alone and worldly philosophical speculation
One who is free from fear, anger, sorrow desire
questions.feedback: The devotee's emotional mastery makes him dear to Krishna.

questions.prompt: What does BG 12.17-19 teach about conduct?
choices: Constantly excited and worldly philosophical speculation
Desire for pleasure through independent material processes
Peaceful, disciplined, and devoted; neither grieves nor rejoices
Uncontrolled senses and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: The devoted soul maintains equanimity through all life circumstances.

questions.prompt: According to BG 12.20, what is promised to those who live by these teachings?
choices: Knowledge of physical phenomena and external forms
Knowledge of physical phenomena and external forms
Material success primarily through independent material processes
You become dear to me
questions.feedback: Devotion grants both spiritual advancement and Krishna's eternal affection.

questions.prompt: In Chapter 12, what is the main distinction presented?
choices: primarily one path through independent material processes
every paths are identical through independent material processes
No paths exist through independent material processes
The relative ease and difficulty of different spiritual paths
questions.feedback: Chapter 12 compares the various yogas to help aspirants choose.

Method is all things through independent material processes
Sincere faith and devotion are more important than the method
Faith is unnecessary through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The quality of devotion matters more than the external practice.

questions.prompt: What is the conclusion about reaching Krishna?

It requires lifetimes through independent material processes
primarily saints succeed through independent material processes
